citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Enclosures are not being spot cleaned daily. There was a build up of feces in multiple indoor boxes that needs to be
removed in both the whelping room and main kennel. Additionally, there was feces that is not falling through the wire
mesh portion of the runs that also needs to be removed. Fecal and food waste must be removed from primary enclosures
daily to prevent soiling of the dogs and reduce odors.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Primary enclosures are not being cleaned and sanitized at least once every two weeks. There is a build up of hair hanging
down from the wood support beams in the whelping room that contains shavings. In addition, there is feces and hair
trapped between wire mesh and the wood support beams around the outdoor enclosures. This accumulation of hair traps
urine, dust, shavings and debris in and around the primary enclosures which can contribute to a strong odor of ammonia
in and around the kennel. These primary enclosures must be cleaned and sanitized at least once every two weeks for the
health of the dogs.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Housekeeping in the whelping room needs to be addressed. There is a layer of dust and debris along the door frames
and tops of enclosures. There is discarded trash (Q-tips) on the floor that was not placed in a trash receptacle but left
among the shavings after being used. There are multiple empty enclosures with food receptacles containing food that is
now caked with dust. These empty enclosures that are adjacent to enclosures containing dogs need to be kept clean to
facilitate good housekeeping practices for the overall health of the dogs in the whelping room.
Correct by: April 1, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.11(a)  Repeat
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Enclosures are not being spot cleaned daily. There was a build up of feces in multiple indoor boxes that needs to be 
removed in both the whelping room and main kennel. Additionally, there was feces that is not falling through the wire 
mesh portion of the runs that also needs to be removed. Fecal and food waste must be removed from primary enclosures 
daily to prevent soiling of the dogs and reduce odors. 
3.11(b)(2)  Repeat
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Primary enclosures are not being cleaned and sanitized at least once every two weeks. There is a build up of hair hanging 
down from the wood support beams in the whelping room that contains shavings. In addition, there is feces and hair 
trapped between wire mesh and the wood support beams around the outdoor enclosures. This accumulation of hair traps 
urine, dust, shavings and debris in and around the primary enclosures which can contribute to a strong odor of ammonia 
in and around the kennel. These primary enclosures must be cleaned and sanitized at least once every two weeks for the 
health of the dogs. 
3.11(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Housekeeping in the whelping room needs to be addressed. There is a layer of dust and debris along the door frames 
and tops of enclosures. There is discarded trash (Q-tips) on the floor that was not placed in a trash receptacle but left 
among the shavings after being used. There are multiple empty enclosures with food receptacles containing food that is 
now caked with dust. These empty enclosures that are adjacent to enclosures containing dogs need to be kept clean to 
facilitate good housekeeping practices for the overall health of the dogs in the whelping room.  
 
Correct by: April 1, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
